headline: Chocolate Zucchini Bread
description: This chocolate zucchini bread is sure to fool your kids — with a double dose of chocolate, they may not even realize they're eating a vegetable!

video.description: This bread is moist and delicious—great for a snack or dessert.
video.name: Chocolate Zucchini Bread I

name: Chocolate Zucchini Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease two 9x5-inch loaf pans.
Melt chocolate in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval, 1 to 3 minutes.

Beat sugar, zucchini, oil, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer until well combined. Beat in melted chocolate. Stir in flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into the prepared loaf pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of each loaf comes out clean, 60 to 70 minutes. Cool to room temperature before slicing.

review.reviewBody: Very good recipe, all recipes is the first place I look for good recipes, I grease my pants and use parchment paper on the bottom, my family loves this recipe, I have made 4 loaves so far! ❤️

It was real moist and yummy. The only challenge I had was the bread did not come out of the loaf pan easy. Recipe called for greasing pan only. I sprayed with coconut oil very liberally and not sure if that was the reason or not. But other then that. The flavor was very good. I added nuts to mine for some added flavor and texture

I used 6 TBSP of cocoa powder and 2 TBSP of butter instead of chocolate squares, three cups of zucchini and applesauce instead of oil. Topped with chocolate chips, walnuts and caramel sauce in a 9x13 pan for 40 minutes. Totally delicious! Thanks for the recipe!

Use mini chips for any fruit or vegetable breads and they will not sink. This recipe is easy to half for one loaf and also easy to modify to your taste such as reducing the oil and sugar by 1\4 each. I agree that it may not need to bake a full 60 minutes, but that depends on your zucchini amount and moisture. Enjoy!!!

The taste was good- not over the top, but good. I give it 3 stars bc as someone else mentioned- it sticks to the pan incredibly bad. I’m not sure why; I greased it a good amount, and I do bake a lot, so it’s not like I’m a newbie. The batter definitely does not make enough for 2 loaves, unless you like them thin. I got one loaf out of it and 8 small cupcake/muffin size. The loaf also cooked in 55 min, not 60-70. Also. The chocolate chips sank to the bottom, even though I coated them in flour. But- to be fair- that’s one area of baking that I’ve never had success at- making chocolate chips not just sink. Lol I think if I make this again, I will grease and flour pan, or, use parchment paper. Maybe eliminate the chocolate chips.

We prefer the 60% chocolate chips, but that was the only change. It was DELICIOUS. One comment for others. Grease and flour loaf pans. I used wilton non-stick pans with light grease. The bottoms stuck! So next time, I'll add a bit of flour to the pan.

Made it exactly as printed except for the 2 squares of unsweetened chocolate. I used 1/2 cup of baking cocoa. It was brownie like with a slight fudgy texture. My husband and Son loved it. I did use a bundt pan since I do not have loaf pans and it came out perfect. This is a keeper every year.

This is by far the best chocolate zucchini bread I have ever made! I always double the vanilla when baking anything, but other than that, I followed instructions. My pans are ceramic, if that makes any difference.

So delicious! I substituted the 2oz chocolate with 6 tbsp cocoa & added 1 teaspoon of baking powder. Greased the pan heavily with butter & the outside came out perfectly crunchy while the inside was moist & light! 
I used one 9x5 inch loaf pan & it fit perfectly. 
Served with whipped cream. 
Will definitely make again!

This is the best I've ever made or eaten. The changes I made are standard baking changes people often make - cocoa instead of squares, replaced half oil with applesauce, changed some sugar to brown (depth of flavor) & reduced sugar amount. Here is what I did: I used 1/2 cup cocoa; 1/2 cup oil & 1/2 cup applesauce; 1 cup brown sugar & 1/2 cup white sugar. I also doubled the zucchini to 4 cups. Most recipes I've made use 2 cups zucchini per loaf. Perfection.
Delicious. My teenage boys approve.

This bread is delicious. I've been making it for years as my go-to zucchini bread recipe.
Just for kicks, I entered it into my Weight Watchers recipe builder just to see how many points I would be eating. Of course, you think zucchini is a vegetable and is healthy so this bread must be not too bad on weight watchers. WRONG. For those of you on weight watchers that haven't taken the time to build the recipe, it's 10 points for 1 piece. That is both loaves cut into 12 pieces each for a total of 24 pieces per recipe. So 1/24 of this recipe is 10 points. As much as I love this bread, it's going to be an occassional treat. My family will not mind the extra pieces that I didn't eat.
love it my go too! to use up squash
Everyone loves it. I used 1 cup of chocolate chips and 2 tbsp of butter + 6 tbsp of cocoa powder to replace the chocolate squares which I didn’t have.

I used 1 1/2 cups sugar , 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 cup coca instead of squares and 1 cup chocolate chips. added zucchini and chips at the end, filled up baking pan 1/2 way, used parchment paper along the bottom and short sides, with some hangover to use as "handles" to remove the bread once it was cooled. served with fresh strawberries and whipped cream, delish!

This is perfect just the way it is. Do not change anything. I’ve made this MANY times and I have friends that can’t wait for me to bring them some. This is also a good one to add dark baking chocolate and dark chocolate chips if you’re not a semi sweet fan. Either way though, this is amazing!!!!!
Very moist and delicious. I followed the helpful tips in the reviews and came out perfectly.
Easy and delicious! This is the best zucchini bread recipe hands down.
Great recipe! Second time making this and I is definitely a hit. Like other comments I floured my chips and also added a little more chocolate and less sugar.

I love love LOVE this recipe. I've made this recipe many many times and I get compliments on it every single time. People say they've never tasted zucchini bread like this! It's the mixture of the cinnamon, the chocolate chips, the moist cake, and everything in between. This is a perfect recipe. I make it in a bundt pan for a nice moist cake, but I've also done mini bundts and cupcakes. But I find that a bigger cake keeps the moisture much better. So good!
I added just about 1 Tab of orange zest. It was delicious

I just had a piece of this cake with my espresso. I loved it and will be making again for sure! I made couple of changes. I used only half the amount of sugar, and I subbed 1/4 cup of the flour for 1/4 cup of cocoa powder to give more chocolate flavor to the cake. Also, I didn't have any unsweetened chocolate, so use some good quality semi sweet dark chocolate instead. The baking time for me was only 40 minutes. FYI, these zucchini breads don't rise much.

Easy and tasty! Had a huge zucchini that needed using. Found this recipe but didn’t have unsweetened chocolate, so used abt 1/3 cup cocoa -wasn’t quite enough. But still great fresh out of the oven. Looking forward to tasting it tomorrow when room temp & choc chips hardened up.
I halved the recipe and used 1 extra large egg. It only took 48 minutes to bake

Made this today and followed the tips to add sour cream (I added a 1/2 cup) and toss the chocolate chips in the dry ingredients to prevent from sinking. My chocolate chips sank anyway :( in any case, it made a yummy loaf! I filled one 9x5 loaf pan and 3 “half sized” silicone loaf molds. The half sized loafs only took 45 min, the 9x5 took 60 minutes. I’m giving 4 stars because I wasn’t a fan of the chocolate chips in the bread - it made it too sweet so for next time, I will either melt half the amount and mix it into the batter or emit it entirely. Still tastes great and all of it will be eaten!

This is a nice and easy recipe and a great way to show your kids that zucchini is ok to eat :) I did not have the unsweetened chocolate and so I used about 1/4 cup of cocoa. I did not add chocolate chips either. Still, it turned out delicious!
Loved the taste, but bread stuck to bottom of pans ... what did i do wrong. This is first time i’ve had this hapoen when baking breads.
This recipe is delicious. Tastes very similar to a brownie.

Everyone loved this bread that is moist and has the texture of cake. I took Missy's suggestion and added some sour cream and cocoa and also increased the zucchini and chocolate chips. The grandkids love it and don't know there is zucchini in it.

Delicious! I swapped flax eggs for regular eggs and applesauce for oil to make lower calorie. Seriously so scrumptious! My kids who are pretty vegetable phobic (3&4) gobbled it up! Tastes like chocolate cake. Will make things many more times.

Based up other reviewers, I made the following positive changes: 2.5 cups of zucchini; 1 cup white sugar, and 1/2-cup brown sugar; 1/2 cup chocolate chips and 1/2 cup espresso chips; no cinnamon. Baked in muffin tins for 20 minutes. Makes 30 muffins. Step aside, Costco double-chocolate muffins, these were the BOMB!
It is so good and moist. One of my favorite breads!

Amazing! I didn’t have enough vegetable oil so I used coconut oil. Because of this I was worried it might be too sweet so I halved the sugar and I’m glad I did. I also took another person’s recommendation and added 1/2 cup of sour cream to make it more moist and a tbls of cocoa powder for more chocolate flavor. 1 accidentally added 2oz of unsweetened chocolate instead of 1 oz but I went with it and I’m glad I did. It turned out so moist and chocolatey. 

I used two 9x5 loaf pans but the cake only filled about half of each - next time I’ll see if I can fit it all into one loaf pan or make “15 servings” for one loaf. 

Great recipe!

My whole family loved it. Had no sour cream on hand, so I used a half cup of whipping cream (unwhipped). Still turned out great. Never lasts long in my house. Any visitor or family member starts taking a taste and ends up eating at least a slice or two!
You should use Parchment Paper. I normally double it up so it comes out beautifully.

I made this twice now. I substituted applesauce for 3/4 cup of oil & used 1/4 cup of grapeseed oil to lower the fat. I also substituted brown sugar instead of white for a deeper flavor. 
The 2nd time I made 1 loaf & 12 muffins. Worked perfectly!
Wonderful recipe just as it is with chopped pecans!!!

I love it.
Changes:
1.5 cups sugar
1 cup espresso and chocolate chips total
3/4 c butter
I made it with gluten free flour (Bobs Red Mill) and my family still gobbled it up. Even my grandson loved both versions. He generally won’t eat anything if he knows it has vegetables in it

Very delicious!! My roommates don't like zucchini in any fashion!!! However, they've been enjoying this recipe for the last week!! I did change it up a little though...someone recommended using sour cream, however I didn't have any. So, I used vanilla Greek yogurt instead. I also added a few spoonfuls of Hershey baking powder, a half cup more sugar, nutmeg, and the mini chocolate chips. I made both loaves, and cupcakes. I personally like it in the cupcake form better. 
I tried to add the pictures but it wouldn't let me, said it was too big.

In trying to make it more diabetic friendly I substituted Swerve regular and brown sugars and used mostly unsweet applesauce with just a tiny bit of oil. I also cut back on the cinnamon and added some ginger, allspice and clove. The hint about coating the chocolate chips in flour was a good one and I did put parchment paper in the bottom of the pans.

Very good zucchini bread! I only used 1 cup of sugar instead of 2, and I melted all the chocolate and put it in with the eggs, oil and sugar. I think it distributes the chocolate more evenly than just dumping in the chips toward the end. Perfect like this, sweet, but not too sweet.

I made this recipe into muffins, and they turned out so good. I used muffin papers so they didn't stick. I am making them again tonight. My 9 year old daughter was grossed out when she saw me using zucchini but she loved them once they were baked.
Very moist but also very sweet. Next time I may cut out the chips and cut down sugar. Thats just due to personal preference since I don't tolerate sugar like I use to. Wonderful chocolate taste!
So good and very moist. Very chocolate!

This bread was delicious! A neighbor gifted a ginormous zucchini, so naturally what new to do with. 

I did not have unsweetened baking squares, only bittersweet, so I also added a tablespoon of cocoa powder to the dry ingredients. I used mini chocolate chips and added them to the dry ingredients also. Following another reviewer, I threw in a half cup of sour cream I needed to use up.

It was fantastic!!! Nice rise, texture and moist. I’m sure it would have been very good also as written.

Well done and thanks for the recipe, a keeper!

Delicious! This is more like a decadent cake than a bread. The only change I made to the procedure was that I melted the chocolate chips with the chocolate squares. That circumvented them settling to the bottom during baking. This is a fantastic way to utilize all of your zucchini harvest!

This was amazing, I will make this again and again! I made one very large loaf and the Remainder went into a flat 9 inch cake pan. I did not have any baking chocolate so used 1/2 cup cocoa and reduced the Sugar to 1 1/2 cups. But then I added extra chocolate chips and mixed them with the dry ingredients. It was perfect and did not stick to the pan!

This is the best Zucchini bread I have ever made. I found this recipe a couple of years ago and have never turned back to any other recipe for Zucchini bread. My family loves nuts so I add walnuts and it is spectacular. The walnuts add a subtle crunch and complement the chocolate and Zucchini. We always have a surplus of Zucchini's from our garden and this is our go-to recipe. I would recommend this and have recommended this recipe to many family members and friends.
This is SUPER FANTASTIC! Followed the advice of another person and added 2 more TBSP of coco powder, added sour cream about 1/2 cup and a little extra zucchini. Wow!!
I have made this bread several times, it is great tasting but always sinks in the middle
Seriously good! Made it with 1/2 c applesauce and 1/2 cup oil - and 2 tsps of baking soda (based on other suggestions) - delicious! I will definitely make this again (and again)

Wow, this recipe is fantastic. I added a hefty dollop of sour cream to the wet ingredients and a few tablespoons of cocoa powder to the dry ingredients. I also sprinkled flour on the chocolate chips so they wouldn't sink. I over-greased my pans. One stuck and the other - a much higher quality pan - came out absolutely perfect. This bread is delicious and will not last long in my home. What a treat!
I have made chocolate zucchini bread for decades. This one is the best. Makes nice cupcakes that freeze well.
I made this and it was absolutely delicious . I will be making this again and again.

I've made at least a half dozen zucchini dessert recipes and this one is my go to. It tastes like chocolate muffins! 5 kids ate their veggies without complaining. The only thing I do differently is substitute cocoa powder for the chocolate bar and add 2 tsp of gluten to make it rise better. Always a hit in my house.

I made this recipe as written, except that I didn't have unsweetened chocolate, so I used semi sweet, and cut down the sugar a bit. We are chocolate lovers, so I threw in a few extra chocolate chips, but this turned out amazing! My kids hate zucchini, but loved this recipe and said they couldn't taste the zucchini. I will definitely make this again.

This bread is so, so good! Didn't have any bakers choc, so I substituted with 5 tbsp. semi-sweet chocolate chips. I also greased and lined the pans with parchment, and left the loaves in the pans for 10 minutes before removing. My new go-to recipe!
The 1 to 1 sugar and flour ratio is too much sugar. And the cinnamon was too much - okay for adults but not kid friendly.
Love it!

This bread was moist & delicious! I did squeeze the water out of the zucchini before mixing in. I also used 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips since I didn’t have Semi sweet. I will definitely be making this again.
Excellent! Easy to make, moist and tasty

This is a delicious chocolate zucchini bread! Made it exactly as is, super moist, dense, great mix of flavors, chocolate and cinnamon and the freshness of the zucchini coming through. I’ve made this a dozen times now and shared with family and friends who love it!

I've now made this twice. First time, I would give it a 5* review. Turned out great. That time, I used my cheese grater to grate the zucchini and added it at the end, as another reviewer recommended. This time, I used a vegetable shredder which got the zucchini down to almost a paste. And I added it with the other liquid ingredients. Turned out a 1*. The cake didn't rise at all and stayed wet in the middle, despite being too hard around the edges. I can only think it was the texture of the zucchini and being added with the wet ingredients? I went over and over it in my mind and I did nothing else differently. So I'm averaging my two tries as a 3*. But I'm a bit reluctant to try again.
This was very moist and I got great reviews at my church.

I doubled the recipe to make two loaves. I might have added a bit more oil. They were so moist, that the consistency was more like a holiday or English pudding. I was so worried they were under-baked but they received rave reviews. The people asked for the recipe. A win!

I made the recipie but my sister is gluten free and I'm vegan. Everything was the same except I used gluten free flour, I made flax egg to replace regular eggs, and my household doesnt like oil so I replaced that will dairy free yogurt. I accidently used spicy chocolate too, but it turned out really great. Definitely would make it again!!

I made it exactly as printed. I must say I was disappointed. My opinion is that I should be able to follow the recipe exactly and have it turn out correctly. Well, the chips fell to the bottom, they stuck to the pan and, of course, overcooked. When a recipe site publishes a recipe, I don't feel I should have to read thru countless reviews to find out HOW to make it turn out right. Actually, i dont have time to do that. The top 3/4 that did come out of the pan tasted great. I will make it again, knowing what others have said to make it correctly.
Very very good bread. As per others suggestions, I increased to 2 1/2 cups of zucchini and 1 cup sour cream. It's a chocolately goodness. I baked 60 minutes. It didn't rise a lot but it is very good!
Always a hit!

Love this it is a great way to sneak zucchini to a kids meal!
You can’t even taste the zucchini!

This was fantastic....You wouldn't know that zucchini was in the batter it totally disappeared. I used 1/2c apple sauce and 1/2c olive oil and simi sweet dark chocolate.
 Will make again.

If you're not a very skilled baker, and I am not, this recipe is a little tough to get right. The hard part is getting the melted chocolate to blend nicely into the batter that is a lower temperature.

I don't get it. I would expect something with the word chocolate in it to be able to taste chocolate. It was just like plain zucchini bread but with chocolate chips in it, no taste of chocolate other then that.
It was moist so I will give it that but chocolaty? No.

Fantastic recipe! After reviewing the comments, I added a cup of sour cream and about a tablespoon of cocoa powder in addition to the other ingredients. There was plenty of batter for two full loaf pans. Both pans disappeared very, very quickly!
Next time I will add cocoa powder and/or an additional chocolate square. Good flavor but notvenough chocolate for me. And grease more.

This was great! It disappeared very quick! 
 My only swap was 2 tablespoons the dark cocoa powder instead of the unsweetened chocolate.
Instead of 2 oz unsweetened chocolate- I used 2TBLS oil and 2 TBLSP Hershey's cocoa. I also used thin spiraled Zucchini. So, we will see!!!
mine was blackened on bottom and didnt come out of the pan well. i liken the non-chocolate zucchini loaf recipe better, it came out perfect. i can easily add choc chips to it next time :)

Super easy to make! Flavourful and moist, although I would add more cinnamon. I'm going to try adding allspice, cloves, nutmeg and pumpkin seeds for an Autumn flavour. I also made a sour cream glaze....DELISH!
Great recipe! Added 2 TBS cocoa powder, decreased sugar, increased zucchini. No news for sour cream, it is moist enough.
I love this recipe! I did put sour cream in one batch and then none in the 2nd batch both were great. This last batch I did as muffins, super yummy.

I have made this bread many times and disappointed when it did not come out of the pan easily. This time I greased the pan and then put parchment paper on the pan bottom and two long sides. The bread came out of the pans beautifully. 
I used mini loaf pans, and I am sure larger pans would work too. Very nice recipe.
My family loves it. My boyfriend said it's so awesomely good that he can't stop eating it. I used cocoa powder and dark chocolate.

I've made this twice. both times I reduced the sugar by about 1/3 and added more flour by about 1/3. it turned out great. I also didnt have to cook it as long as this said. I think it depends on the size of your pan, if the mix is deeper it will take longer to cook. I cooked it in a pyrex instead of a cake pan and it didnt take quite as long. I also like the suggestion to put in mini chocolate chips. I didnt have any unsweetened chocolate squares, so I melted butter, sugar and cocoa together instead.

Perfect chocolate bread! I followed the recipe as is. The second time I made this, I added some chopped walnuts and mini chocolate chips. I also added 1/2 c applesauce and 1/2 c oil. This is a winner!!

Perfect chocolate bread! I followed the recipe as is. The second time I made this, I added some chopped walnuts and mini chocolate chips. I also added 1/2 c applesauce and 1/2 c oil. This is a winner!!
great the way it is, made no changes. Kids love it
Zuchinni bread was great; I didn't make any changes but I'll add cocoa powder the next time I make it! I used PAM baking spray with flour and no problem sticking.

I would definitely make this again. 
I made it with 1-1/2c. sugar. I also put in 1/2 c. oil and 1/2 c. applesauce, and 1/2 c. sour cream. I followed the reviews and coated my choc. chips with flour and folded the zucchini in before placing it in the oven. 
It didn't rise as much as some of the other breads I have made but, it was still really good.

I made it several times. Great recipe! I did squeeze some of the liquid out of the zucchini after the first batch as it took longer than 60 minutes to cook. Flouring the chocolate chips was also a game changer.
Very nice even texture, used mini-chocolate chips and was pleased that they didn't stick to the bottom of the pan. Will be making this again!

Added a little extra cocoa and sugar. Didnt tell anyone it was zucchini bread until it was gone.
They wanted more : )
Instead of chocolate chips I diced up some raspberries and added them right at before pouring into pans! So good!

Yummy! I replaced half of the oil with applesauce and because chocolate is sacred in my family - I added 1 cup of chocolate chips and 1 tbs of cocoa powder. I also followed the recommendations of others and mixed the chocolate chips in with the dry ingredients first and added the zuchinni very last after everything else had been mixed in. Otherwise no changes. 
My only note of caution - my loaves were done in 50 minutes instead of the 60-70 minutes recommended in the recipe. Thank you for the recipe!
Definitely grease the pan more then you think you need. But so chocolaty.
Really good. The recipe made 12 muffins plus a 9x9 cake.
I thought it tasted great. Couldn't even tell zucchini was in it.

This bread turned out so good! Super moist! My husband thinks it's fantastic. I made just a few small changes- added about 3/4 cup sour cream, 1T cocoa powder, a bit more zucchini, reduced the amount of sugar to 1 1/2 cups and used a full cup of chocolate chips (tossed with some flour). Thanks for the recipe!
Very yummy. Flour your pans as well as grease.
